## blockRendering.TopRow class

An object containing information about what elements are in the top row of a block as well as sizing information for the top row. Elements in a top row can consist of corners, hats, spacers, and previous connections. After this constructor is called, the row will contain all non-spacer elements it needs.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class TopRow extends Row 
```
<b>Extends:</b> [Row](./blockly.blockrendering_namespace.row_class.md)

## Remarks

The constructor for this class is marked as internal. Third-party code should not call the constructor directly or create subclasses that extend the `TopRow` class.

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [ascenderHeight](./blockly.blockrendering_namespace.toprow_class.ascenderheight_property.md) |  | number | How much the row extends up above its capline. |
|  [connection](./blockly.blockrendering_namespace.toprow_class.connection_property.md) |  | [PreviousConnection](./blockly.blockrendering_namespace.previousconnection_class.md) \| null | The previous connection on the block, if any. |
|  [hasPreviousConnection](./blockly.blockrendering_namespace.toprow_class.haspreviousconnection_property.md) |  | boolean | Whether the block has a previous connection. |
